name: Bubsy 3D
overview: Bubsy 3D (also called Bubsy Is 3D in Furbitten Planet and Bubsy 3D: Furbitten Planet) is a platform video game developed by Eidetic and distributed by Accolade and Telstar for the PlayStation video game console. Designed by Michael Berlyn, the game was released on November 25, 1996 in North America and in August 1997 in Europe. It is the fourth in the Bubsy series and, as the title indicates, the first (and only) Bubsy game in 3D. It also pioneered a 3D platformer, with very limited movement. The name of the game is a pun between the words "furry" and "Forbidden Planet," a 1956 science fiction film. Lani Minella voices her to all the characters in the game, including Bubsy. https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bubsy_3D Run jump swim and fly anywhere in huge 3D worlds full of zany humor and the Bubsy 'tude! Scrounge-up the 32 missing pieces of your escape rocket or kiss your homeworld goodbye! Shoot atoms and bop woolies clambos and 12 other wacky creatures as you rip into planet Rayon! Get your paws on a mess of atoms for extra lives bonus rounds and useful rocket fuel! Play "cat and mouse" in a unique 2-Player mode!
